intro: Rubus mingendensis, commonly known as the Mingendens raspberry, is a species of bramble native to China. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red when mature. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within the Rubus genus.
